subject: Sexual Health
title: How the Brain Processes Decisions
description: One-minute skill: How the Brain Processes Decisions.

hook.text: The prefrontal cortex handles complex decisions like consent. It is also one of the last brain areas to mature.

buildup.text: This region evaluates risks, weighs consequences, and balances impulses against long-term outcomes.

discovery.text: The prefrontal cortex is not fully developed until about age 25, affecting decision-making in young adults.

twist.text: Emotional arousal can temporarily reduce prefrontal activity, making rational choices harder in the moment.

climax.text: Understanding brain development explains why consent education must start early and be reinforced often.

punchline.text: The brain's decision center matures slowly.

quiz.question: When is the prefrontal cortex fully developed?
